references.paper_title: Dynode: Neural ordinary differential equations for dynamics modeling in continuous control
references.reason: This paper introduces DyNODE, a neural ordinary differential equation model used as a benchmark to evaluate the performance of the proposed D3 framework.

references.paper_title: Structured population models in biology and epidemiology
references.reason: This book provides foundational context on structured population models, which are relevant to the dynamical systems studied in the paper.

references.paper_title: Discovering governing equations from data by sparse identification of nonlinear dynamical systems
references.reason: This paper introduces the Sparse Identification of Nonlinear Dynamics (SINDy) method, a benchmark model used for comparison against the proposed D3 framework.
This paper introduces Neural ODEs, a class of models used for comparison with the proposed D3 framework, demonstrating a key advance in the field of dynamical systems modeling.

references.paper_title: Prediction of Treatment Response for Combined Chemo- and Radiation Therapy for Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Patients Using a Bio-Mathematical Model
references.reason: This paper provides a state-of-the-art bio-mathematical model for lung cancer tumor growth, which is used to generate benchmark datasets for evaluating the D3 framework's performance.
